page.title: 18Religion
page.content: {Church going}is no longer universal as it was 50 years ago.The reasons are many and varied.However,congregations are as large as ever for special services such as Christmas,Easter,the Harvest Festival,marriages,funerals and baptisms.{St.Leonard's Anglican {Church }is the only church still open in the area.The tower was built in 1715 but the nave etc. was built in 1856 at the expense of the incumbent. The most interesting internal feature is the Italian stained glass in two of the windows.These were stranded in Paris during the 1870-71 Siege.{Church {links with the Commmunity}are still of great importance and the Rector still occupies an important position in local society.{Church and School}links are also close.Although the school is small the children participate fully in all the important festivals.
